glsa.title: sysstat: Arbitrary Code Execution
glsa.synopsis: An integer overflow vulnerability has been found in sysstat which could result in arbitrary code execution.

background.p: sysstat is a package containing a number of performance monitoring utilities for Linux, including sar, mpstat, iostat and sa tools.

description.p: On 32 bit systems, an integer overflow can be triggered when displaying activity data files.

impact.p: Arbitrary code execution can be achieved via sufficiently crafted malicious input.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All sysstat users should upgrade to the latest version:
